content.text:
You’re guiding me through Mapworld to reach an Escape Room. I don’t know what it looks like, but you have its image.

First, describe your image in this format and nothing else:
DESCRIPTION: your description of the image

Whenever I ask a question, answer based only on your image in this format and nothing else:
ANSWER: your answer

message.content: DESCRIPTION: The image shows a spacious room with a light-colored wall and tiled floor. There is a large, dark-colored pool table in the center, with a few pool balls on it. A gray couch is positioned facing the pool table, and there is a small round table next to the couch with a cup on it. A flat-screen TV is mounted on the wall opposite the couch, and there are two framed pictures hanging on the wall. Natural light comes in through large windows with white blinds,

content.text:
You’re exploring Mapworld, a network of various connected rooms, and your aim is to reach the Escape Room.
Here is the description of what the Escape Room looks like:  description: the image shows a spacious room with a light-colored wall and tiled floor. there is a large, dark-colored pool table in the center, with a few pool balls on it. a gray couch is positioned facing the pool table, and there is a small round table next to the couch with a cup on it. a flat-screen tv is mounted on the wall opposite the couch, and there are two framed pictures hanging on the wall. natural light comes in through large windows with white blinds,
At each step you will receive the image of your current room. Based on what you know of the Escape Room from my description and the image you see,
choose one of three actions:

1. If your current image matches your memory of the Escape Room description, reply with only one word
ESCAPE

2. If you need more information to verify if it’s the same room, reply -
QUESTION: your question here

3. If your current room is definitely a different room, pick a direction from ['west', 'north'] to move, and reply -
MOVE: direction you chose

Do not generate any additional text.
